narratives.question_text: If a requirement, did this course occur in proper sequence within the School's educational program?  If not, where should it occur?
comments: This course was an elective, but I believe that it was a good course to takeduring your 2nd year.
Yes, it did.

Since the subject of the course is highly special and specific, I think thiscourse is better to be kept as elective. It should be available for students who wants to explore the topic of ornamentation.
In proper sequence with the school program.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the body of material presented and the content of the course: sequence, syllabus, and assignments.
comments: First half of the semester, students learn theoretical material for the course, and it is great. Personally spending good amount of time learning theoretical stances on the matter really grounded my project firmly. However, i wish I had more time with my project. Perhaps starting to design just before the spring break might help. Because fabrication of the project takes certain amount of time, design process was cut short.
The course covers from Ruskin to today, so it is extremely comprehensive. The required reading responses, however, were too much work for a class that does not require a final paper.
The content of both reading and case study material were very helpful and clear. It provided goog understading of the subject, "ornament and technology".

The materials are very comprehensive and related to the topic. Half seminar and half fabrication program is interesting but leaves less time for the final project, especially when students are all busy with their studio and paper production.

The course divides the semester into two parts. The first provides theoretical background and the second seeks material experimentation. This general structure is effective but I think that the amount of time for the material exercise was too short and the theoretical discussion maybe too long. Starting the material exercise earlier in the semester will provide the students more time to accomplish a more refined and challenging production.The first assignment that required an exploration of the CNC tools of the school was interesting but the assignment of making a model from the readings was not very productive.

The readings and discussions essentially dealt with how to define "ornament" in the modern age, but I feel we never reached a clear definition of what ornament is. That being said, my understanding of the issues improved significantly.

narratives.question_text: What were your expectations for this course and how well were they met?
comments: My expectations were medium, and they were met. However, I expected less theory and more building, and that was not the case.
The expectation for this course was to learn and discuss on ornament. Due to the short amount of time for the design and fabrication, the second half of the seminar was little of frustration.
My expectations are met quite well. The discourse is interesting by itself and our project came out nice as we hoped, thanks to Ben's helpful criticism.

I expected to learn about the discussions on ornament and understand its relevance in contemporary practice and my expectations were met. The results of the fabrication exercise were not as successful as I expected.

I expected to gain a better understanding of the theory of ornament and its relevance to the contemporary architectural discourse. I would say that the readings and assignments satisfied these expectations.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the value of this course to you.
comments: This course has a medium value for me, and it was met.
It was really valuable and provided a lot of different understading of architecture and architectural ornament. I would encourage students to take the course next year.
This course introduced to me an unfamiliar territory and is certainly very valuable. The touch on both theories and practice is also helpful.
It was a valuable course in my education and gave me access to an unknown field for me.

narratives.question_text: Comment on the effectiveness of the teaching by the courses's instructor
comments: I wish, as in every seminar, that the teacher would teach more. I dont understand why the students present all the material?
Benn organized the discussion very welled. He led the section in order to keep both acknowledging and intersting.
Ben is very effective and professional in terms of teaching and critics. He is always helpful and kind, very intelligent and organized.
Ben was effective and responsible.

Ben was usually able to explain the issues discussed in the readings, and he guided the discussion towards understanding what ornament is and how it is relevant to contemporary practice. That being said, he was often vague about his expectations for the assignments.

narratives.question_text: Suggestions you may have for course improvements:
comments: They reading/responding period of the course could be shortened to give the students more time to prepare their final projects.
Design project can start ealrier than this semster. It will provide more flexible time to use tools and machine as well.
I think it'll be better if Ben is more passionate and enthusiastic about the topic and the seminar would be livelier and more interesing discussions will yield.
See question number 4.
